html: After years of warfare and relentless oppression have worn people down, those of humanity left alive when the archtyrant perishes burst into jubilant celebration. Now can the earth rest and Jehovah’s millennial reign of peace begin. Jehovah’s axe and saw, his rod and staff (v 5; Isaiah 9:4; 10:15), has finished his work of destruction; the “hewer” of Jehovah’s people and the nations (Isaiah 10:33-34; 37:24) has himself been hewn down. The “pine trees” and “cedars of Lebanon”—here signifying a surviving middle category of Jehovah’s people—may now flourish unhindered (Isaiah 41:19-20; 60:13).
